File path: src/diffusers/schedulers/scheduling_vq_diffusion.py

Docstring: none provided.

Imports: ConfigMixin, register_to_config, dataclass, numpy, SchedulerMixin, torch, torch.nn.functional, typing.Optional, typing.Tuple, typing.Union, utils.BaseOutput

Globals: none.

Class summaries: VQDiffusionScheduler: Manages diffusion schedule for models that operate on vector-quantized latent representations, maintaining parameters such as number of embedding classes, diffusion timesteps, cumulative alpha/gamma curves, provides utilities to compute transitions, posterior distributions, and step updates during diffusion process.

VQDiffusionSchedulerOutput: Encapsulates result of a diffusion scheduler step, storing computed previous latent sample that will be fed back into model for next denoising iteration.

Standalone function summaries: alpha_schedules: Simple helper alpha_schedules. gamma_schedules: Simple helper gamma_schedules. gumbel_noised: Simple helper gumbel_noised. index_to_log_onehot: Simple helper index_to_log_onehot.

Thus the module provides a scheduler for VQ diffusion models, with helper functions for alpha/gamma schedules, Gumbel noise, and one-hot encoding.

We need to produce summary: high-level description of module responsibilities.

Business intent: maybe "enable diffusion-based generation with vector-quantized latent spaces for generative AI applications".

Keywords: diffusion scheduler, vector quantization, latent representation, alpha schedule, gamma schedule, Gumbel noise, one-hot encoding, denoising, generative modeling, PyTorch.
